subagents.name: accessibility-specialist
subagents.description: Ensure web applications meet WCAG 2.1 AA/AAA standards. Implements ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support. Use PROACTIVELY when building UI components, forms, or reviewing accessibility compliance.

subagents.name: ai-engineer
subagents.description: Build LLM applications, RAG systems, and prompt pipelines. Implements vector search, agent orchestration, and AI API integrations. Use PROACTIVELY for LLM features, chatbots, or AI-powered applications.

subagents.name: api-documenter
subagents.description: Create OpenAPI/Swagger specs, generate SDKs, and write developer documentation. Handles versioning, examples, and interactive docs. Use PROACTIVELY for API documentation or client library generation.

subagents.name: arbitrage-bot
subagents.description: Identify and execute cryptocurrency arbitrage opportunities across exchanges and DeFi protocols. Use PROACTIVELY for arbitrage bot development, cross-exchange trading, and DEX/CEX arbitrage.

subagents.name: backend-architect
subagents.description: Design RESTful APIs, microservice boundaries, and database schemas. Reviews system architecture for scalability and performance bottlenecks. Use PROACTIVELY when creating new backend services or APIs.

subagents.name: blockchain-developer

subagents.name: business-analyst

subagents.name: cloud-architect

subagents.name: code-reviewer
subagents.description: Expert code review specialist. Proactively reviews code for quality, security, and maintainability. Use immediately after writing or modifying code.

subagents.name: content-marketer
subagents.description: Write blog posts, social media content, and email newsletters. Optimizes for SEO and creates content calendars. Use PROACTIVELY for marketing content or social media posts.

subagents.name: context-manager
subagents.description: Manages context across multiple agents and long-running tasks. Use PROACTIVELY when coordinating complex multi-agent workflows or when context needs to be preserved across multiple sessions. MUST BE USED for projects exceeding 10k tokens.

subagents.name: cpp-engineer
subagents.description: Write idiomatic C++ code with modern features, RAII, smart pointers, and STL algorithms. Handles templates, move semantics, and performance optimization. Use PROACTIVELY for C++ refactoring, memory safety, or complex C++ patterns.

subagents.name: crypto-trader

subagents.name: customer-support
subagents.description: Handle support tickets, FAQ responses, and customer emails. Creates help docs, troubleshooting guides, and canned responses. Use PROACTIVELY for customer inquiries or support documentation.

subagents.name: data-engineer

commands.name: add-to-changelog
commands.description: Add a new entry to the project's CHANGELOG.md file following Keep a Changelog format

commands.name: bug-fix
commands.description: Systematic workflow for fixing bugs including issue creation, branch management, and PR submission

commands.name: check
commands.description: Run project checks and fix any errors without committing

commands.name: clean
commands.description: Fix all linting and formatting issues across the codebase

commands.name: code_analysis
commands.description: Perform comprehensive code analysis with quality metrics and recommendations

commands.name: commit
commands.description: Create well-formatted git commits with conventional commit messages and emoji

commands.name: commit-fast
commands.description: Automatically create and execute a git commit using the first suggested commit message

commands.name: context-prime
commands.description: Load project context by reading README.md and exploring relevant project files

commands.name: create-command
commands.description: Create a new command following existing patterns and organizational structure

commands.name: create-docs
commands.description: Analyze GitHub issue and create technical specification with implementation plan

commands.name: create-jtbd
commands.description: Create a Jobs to be Done (JTBD) document for a product feature focusing on user needs

commands.name: create-pr
commands.description: Create a new branch, commit changes, and submit a pull request with automatic commit splitting

commands.name: create-prd
commands.description: Create a Product Requirements Document (PRD) for a product feature

commands.name: create-prp
commands.description: Create a comprehensive Product Requirement Prompt (PRP) with research and context gathering

commands.name: create-pull-request
commands.description: Guide for creating pull requests using GitHub CLI with proper templates and conventions

commands.name: create-worktrees
commands.description: Manage git worktrees for open PRs and create new branch worktrees

commands.name: docs
commands.description: Update or generate YAML documentation for SQL models with proper descriptions and tests

commands.name: explain-issue-fix
commands.description: Explain how tasks in an issue were implemented with detailed breakdown

commands.name: five
commands.description: Apply the Five Whys root cause analysis technique to systematically investigate issues

commands.name: fix-github-issue
commands.description: Analyze and fix a GitHub issue with comprehensive testing and verification

commands.name: fix-issue
commands.description: Fix a specific issue or problem with the given identifier or description

commands.name: fix-pr
commands.description: Fetch unresolved comments for current branch's PR and fix them

commands.name: husky
commands.description: Verify repository is in working state by running CI checks and fixing issues

commands.name: initref
commands.description: Build reference documentation by creating markdown files and updating CLAUDE.md

commands.name: mermaid
commands.description: Create entity relationship diagrams using Mermaid from SQL/database files

commands.name: optimize
commands.description: Analyze code performance and propose three specific optimization improvements

commands.name: pr-review
commands.description: Conduct comprehensive PR review from multiple perspectives (PM, Developer, QA, Security)

commands.name: prime
commands.description: Load project context by reading key documentation files and exploring project structure

commands.name: release
commands.description: Prepare a new release by updating changelog, version, and documentation

commands.name: repro-issue
commands.description: Reproduce a specific issue by creating a failing test case

commands.name: rsi
commands.description: Read project commands and documentation to optimize AI-assisted development process

commands.name: run-ci
commands.description: Run CI checks and fix any errors until all tests pass

commands.name: tdd
commands.description: Test-driven development workflow with Red-Green-Refactor process and branch management

commands.name: todo
commands.description: Manage project todos in a todos.md file with add, complete, remove, and list operations

commands.name: update-branch-name
commands.description: Update current git branch name based on analysis of changes made

commands.name: update-docs
commands.description: Update implementation documentation including specs, status, and best practices

commands.name: use-stepper
commands.description: Use structured stepper approach for problem-solving and project development

mcpServers.name: @8enSmith/mcp-open-library
mcpServers.description: Enable AI assistants to search and retrieve detailed book and author information from the Open Library. Provide structured, consistent JSON responses for book titles, author details, and cover images. Enhance AI capabilities with comprehensive book and author data access via a standardized protocol.

mcpServers.name: @aakarsh-sasi/memory-bank-mcp
mcpServers.description: Manage your AI assistant's context seamlessly across sessions. Store, retrieve, and track information with remote server support for enhanced collaboration and persistence.

mcpServers.name: @adalovu/mcp-playwright
mcpServers.description: Enable LLMs to automate and interact with web browsers using Playwright. Perform actions like taking screenshots, generating test code, scraping web pages, and executing JavaScript in real browser environments. Enhance your AI agents with powerful browser automation capabilities seamlessly integrated via MCP.

mcpServers.name: @albinjal/multi-agent-debate-mcp
mcpServers.description: Enable structured multi-agent debates between AI personas with formal argumentation, rebuttals, and judgments across multiple rounds. Facilitate complex decision-making and collaborative problem-solving through adversarial discussion. Track verdicts automatically and support flexible agent roles for educational and simulation purposes.

mcpServers.name: @alperenkocyigit/semantic-scholar-graph-api
mcpServers.description: Provide AI assistants with seamless access to Semantic Scholar's extensive academic database for advanced paper discovery, author research, citation analysis, and content exploration. Enable natural language search, bulk data processing, and detailed academic insights to enhance research workflows. Empower users to efficiently explore millions of research papers and citation networks.

mcpServers.name: @Aman-Amith-Shastry/scientific_computation_mcp
mcpServers.description: This MCP server enables users to perform scientific computations regarding linear algebra and vector calculus through natural language. The server is designed to bridge the gap between users and powerful computational libraries such as NumPy and SymPy. Its goal is to make scientific computing more accessible.

mcpServers.name: @aniruddha-adhikary/gahmen-mcp
mcpServers.display_name: MCP Server for Singapore Government Open Data
mcpServers.description: Provide seamless access to open datasets and collections from data.gov.sg. Enable searching, metadata retrieval, and filtered dataset downloads for analysis.

mcpServers.name: @aptro/superset-mcp
mcpServers.description: Connect and control your Apache Superset instance programmatically with ease. Enable AI agents to manage dashboards, charts, and databases using natural language requests. Streamline your data exploration and visualization tasks effortlessly.

mcpServers.name: @baranwang/mcp-trends-hub
mcpServers.description: Aggregate trending topics from various platforms in one place. Access real-time hot lists from sources like Weibo, Douyin, and Tencent News effortlessly. Stay updated with the latest trends and insights at your fingertips.

mcpServers.name: @blockscout/mcp-server

Enable multi-chain support and deliver enhanced user experience with progress notifications for long-running queries. Facilitate seamless integration with AI hosts like Claude Desktop for blockchain data analysis.

Enable searching, reading, and updating Laravel docs dynamically to enhance AI-driven development support. Support multiple Laravel versions and automatic documentation updates from GitHub.

mcpServers.name: @browserbasehq/mcp-browserbase
mcpServers.description: Provides cloud browser automation capabilities using Stagehand and Browserbase, enabling LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and run parallel sessions in a cloud browser environment.

mcpServers.name: @browserbasehq/mcp-stagehand
mcpServers.description: Provides cloud browser automation capabilities using Stagehand, enabling LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a cloud browser environment.

mcpServers.name: @clay-inc/clay-mcp

mcpServers.name: @EduBase/MCP

Integrate with your existing systems through our secure API. Check out our GitHub page for more details and setup instructions!

installation_methods.command: claude mcp add --transport sse EduBase-MCP https://mcp.smithery.ai/sse/@EduBase/MCP

mcpServers.name: @imbenrabi/financial-modeling-prep-mcp-server
mcpServers.description: Complete financial market access for AI assistants - Real-time stocks, crypto, forex, and comprehensive market data integration - access FMP free and paid API tiers. 250+ financial tools covering stock analysis, cryptocurrency trading, market intelligence, and portfolio management. Configure specific tool subsets for streamlined workflows. (BETA) Dynamic Tool Management: For improved efficiency and a lower cognitive load on the AI, our server now supports dynamic tool discovery. The AI assistant starts with a core set of tools and can request to activate additional toolsets as needed during a session. This ensures the AI has access to the right tools at the right time without being overwhelmed by the full list of 250+ functions. * Currently this feature requires self hosting. Support selective tool sets activation via configuration for improved performance. Markets: Real-time stocks, crypto, forex, global exchanges (NYSE, NASDAQ) Analysis: Company fundamentals, technical indicators, financial ratios Intelligence: News sentiment, analyst ratings, economic indicators Trading: Portfolio tracking, risk metrics, backtesting tools Categories: Finance, Trading, Cryptocurrency, Investment, Market Data API Documentation: https://site.financialmodelingprep.com/developer/docs
